Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a plant that is healthy and growing with plenty of water and light, showing vibrant green leaves and upright posture.
The student can illustrate a wilted or unhealthy plant without enough water, accurately depicting droopy leaves and possibly with browning edges.
The student can accurately show a plant that does not grow when placed in dark conditions, indicating a lack of growth or yellowish leaves.
The student can clearly demonstrate through drawings the patterns in plant conditions to indicate the need for water and light (e.g., side-by-side comparisons).
The student can effectively illustrate the difference in plant conditions between those receiving sufficient water and light and those that do not, with clear visual distinctions.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally overlook minor details in their drawings (e.g., inconsistent leaf coloration) but this does not significantly impact the overall understanding.
The student might not fully label every part of the plant or condition in all drawings, but the visual representation remains strong.
